NASA\'s High Energy Solar Spectroscopic Imager spacecraft \-- an international mission to explore the basic physics of particle acceleration and energy release in solar flares \-- has sustained substantial damage during vibration testing. Repairs to the spacecraft, known as HESSI, will likely delay its launch to no earlier than January 2001.


Date: 2000-03-24 21:03:00

[![NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory, California Institute of
Technology](http://www.jpl.nasa.gov/images/){width="100"
height="75"}](http://www.jpl.nasa.gov/news/&rn=news.xml&rst=4949)\
\
NASA\'s High Energy Solar Spectroscopic Imager spacecraft \-- an
international mission to explore the basic physics of particle
acceleration and energy release in solar flares \-- has sustained
substantial damage during vibration testing. Repairs to the spacecraft,
known as HESSI, will likely delay its launch to no earlier than January
2001.

\
